links.title: Saudi Government Proves Basic Income Is No Solution To Slow Economic Growth
links.description: Saudi Arabia recently announced pay cuts for all government employees, including no pay increases, no bonuses, and limits on annual leave. This is in response to low oil prices, but we can also draw a lesson about the futility of imagining that simply giving everybody a basic income would magically sustain or grow an economy.

links.description: Efficiency is the (often measurable) ability to avoid wasting materials, energy, efforts, money, and time in doing something or in producing a desired result.
